content.description:
Looking for a pump, rope gun? Once you've put up

Left X

and TR'd

Red Book

a few times and you're feeling like hot shit, give the far left arete a go. Climb steep jugs and crimps until the arete blanks. Make harrrrd moves up and right on tiny slimpers. It'll keep you humble.
content.protection:
This TR has its own anchor, but you can also use one of the bolts as a directional and TR off of the standard

Left X

anchor- though this will lead to rope wear on the slab- so maybe don't do that.
content.location:
The SW arete of X Rock. Left of

Red Book

.

content.description:
This is the leftmost route on the east face of X Rock, just to the left of

Boulder It Out

and

Monkey Hang

.
content.protection:
This can pretty easily be done on top rope from the

Right X

belay ledge or even the anchor for

School Room

. There are 3 bolts, but the 3rd bolt is currently missing.
content.location: Start to the far left on the east face of X Rock, move slightly to the right past the crux move, and then go straight up from there.

content.description: Boulder the face between the X-Cracks and escape via Right Crack.
This is an easy intro route for all climbers. Many variations exist, but most popular is the crack that starts the the far right, then moves left to a three bolt anchor.
content.protection: 8-13 stoppers. 3 bolt anchor 15 feet from summit, or 2 bolt anchor at summit.
content.location: This is on the east face near the 5.0 crack for the TR set up.

content.description:
Start by climbing either

Red Book

or

Left X

.  From the top of these, move right and face climb past one bolt up through the roof.
content.protection: Standard rack and one bolt at the roof.
content.location: This is on the left side of the south face.

content.description: Climb through an initial wide section, angling left towards the center of the X.  Then angle back right, ending at a stance at the top of the crack.
content.protection: Standard rack with possibly a larger piece.
content.location: This is on the right side of the south face.

content.description: Face climbing leads up to a right-angling, right-facing corner.  This route can easily be top-roped or is an interesting lead for the grade.
content.location:
Left side of the south face, just left of

Left X

.

content.description:
This is pretty much an overhanging boulder problem that leads to the

Schoolroom Race

(5.3) above.  It is fun with big jugs.
content.protection: Crash pad or toprope off bolted anchor at the top of Schoolroom Face.
content.location: It is on the east face, around the corner to the right of the "X".

content.description: Climb the finger crack start angling right towards the center of the X.  Then climb the hand crack angling left to the top of the crack.
content.location: Start on the left side of the south face.

content.description:
Climb the face on the right side of the south face, passes one drilled pin and ends at the same belay as

Right X

.
content.location:
Right side of the south face, just right of

Right X

.

content.description:
Start similar to ?Monkey Hang?, but move father left and continue up the face to the

Right X

belay ledge.
content.protection: Boulder problem or set a toprope.
content.location:
This is on the east face, just left of

Monkey Hang

.
